intro: Chaerophyllum cicutaria, commonly known as the meadow parsley or smooth chaerophyllum, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and wetlands. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions. The plant's botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its family.
